;In the process of the conversation, for every specific question Spier raised, Buffet invariably inspired him with simple but philosophic ideas. During lunch, Buffet often talked about his life and his principles on doing things. For example, his father taught him to rely on his own judgment instead of relying on others to judge when he was young. "It is very important to live one’s own life according to his standard of inner heart,” Spier quoted Buffett’s saying. If you wanted to know whether you do things by following this principle, you only need to ask yourself a simple question that is whether you would like to be regarded as the best lover for the world and the worst for yourself, or whether you would like to be regarded as the best lover for yourself and the worst for the world? When those above ideas are applied to the investment, Buffett is doing extremely well: Completely trust in himselef, invest in “his own ability scope”, and cooperate with the people who has same values with him.
